commands.name: az network service-endpoint policy create
commands.syntax:
az network service-endpoint policy create --name
                                          --resource-group
                                          [--location]
                                          [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                          [--tags]
examples: az network service-endpoint policy create --name MyServiceEndpointPolicy --resource-group MyResourceGroup

commands.name: az network service-endpoint policy delete
commands.syntax:
az network service-endpoint policy delete [--ids]
                                          [--name]
                                          [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                          [--resource-group]
                                          [--subscription]
examples: az network service-endpoint policy delete -g MyResourceGroup -n MyPolicy

commands.name: az network service-endpoint policy list
examples: az network service-endpoint policy list --resource-group MyResourceGroup

commands.name: az network service-endpoint policy show
commands.summary: Get the details of a service endpoint policy.
examples: az network service-endpoint policy show --name MyServiceEndpointPolicy --resource-group MyResourceGroup

commands.name: az network service-endpoint policy update
commands.syntax:
az network service-endpoint policy update [--add]
                                          [--force-string {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                          [--ids]
                                          [--name]
                                          [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                          [--remove]
                                          [--resource-group]
                                          [--set]
                                          [--subscription]
                                          [--tags]
examples: az network service-endpoint policy update -g MyResourceGroup -n MyPolicy --tags test=nest

commands.name: az network service-endpoint policy wait
commands.summary: Place the CLI in a waiting state until a condition is met.
